page.title: 13CHANGES NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: Plant life survives for the most part in spite of man,not because of him. Dense plantations of conifers have obliterated the plants which once grew healthily under the branches of the deciduous trees.The downland plant populations have been steadily reduced by the increased cultivation and use the use of chemical sprays. A further factor to consider is the major ecological change on the downland caused by a long-term decline in sheep flocks and the introduction of myxomatosis.The short,close turf of the downs produced by the nibbling of generations of sheep and rabbits is giving way to areas of scrub consisting of wider and untypical flora spreading up the slopes. If this continues,a major characteristic of downland will disappear.
